entry.title: Show 4: Ruby 2.1
entry.content:
A panel discussion about the imminent Ruby 2.1 Release and the changes likely to be included.

MP3 Download, RSS Subscribe

Topics covered:

  • Refinements
  • Call site method caching
  • Generational garbage collector How to make Perfume dance
  • Frozen string literals
  • Method definition returns method name
  • Decimal literals
  • StringScanner uses named captures
  • Required keyword arguments
  • Updated RubyGems

Panelists

  • Henry Maddocks
  • James Harton
  • Samson Ootoovak
  • Shevaun Coker
  • Tim Carey-Smith

entry.title: Show 3: Capistrano with Lee Hambley
entry.content:
An interview with Lee Hambley (github, twitter) about Capistrano, it’s current status and maintainership.

MP3 Download, RSS Subscribe

Interview questions:

  • What got you interested in Capistrano in the first place?
  • How did you become the maintainer of Capistrano?
  • Can you summarise your recent public statement?
  • What did it feel like to have to admit that it was all too much?
  • What was the response to your public statement?
  • How are you feeling about it today?
  • Will you consider maintaining large open source projects in future?
  • How has maintaining a large open source project impacted your usage of other large projects?
  • What advice do you have to reduce the likelihood of other project maintainers reaching the same point of burnout?
  • What things can contributors or users of open source do to help maintainers?

Panelists:

  • Amanda Wagener
  • Henry Maddocks
  • James Harton
  • Philip Arndt
  • Tim Carey-Smith

entry.title: Show 2: A globally distributed team
entry.content:
An interview with Andrew Hooker (github, twitter) and Ryan Bigg (github, twitter) of Spree Commerce, where we discuss the implications of working inside of a globally distributed team, and on a set of products which comprise a large open source component.

MP3 Download, RSS Subscribe

Topics covered:

  • How Spree is coordinated and features are decided
  • Sprint planning across time zones
  • GitHub workflow
  • Spree team structure
  • How teams work across great distances

Panelists:

  • Amanda Wagener
  • Henry Maddocks
  • James Harton
  • Philip Arndt
  • Tim Carey-Smith

entry.title: Show 1: Intro to "do"
entry.content:
Who are these people? Why should I listen to them? Can they diverge onto massive tangents for many minutes at a time? Download MP3.

To find out the answer to all these questions and more, listen to our first ever show. Available for your downloading pleasure here or you can subscribe to our RSS feed in your favourite podcatcher.
